definition: woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)

sentences.english: Coconuts and powder-like sand help too.
sentences.chinese: 椰林和滑石粉般細膩的沙子也會爲沙灘增色不少。

sentences.english: I had assumed it was a water colour, only to be told it was painted in Yelin Colour Ink.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲那是水的顏色，只能說它是畫在椰林彩色墨水。

sentences.english: To step in the evening of blade with the king in eastern north division meet homing.
sentences.chinese: 來晚一步的刀鋒與王師北在東郊椰林相遇。

sentences.english: Coconut trees and palms have a tropical flavour.
I know you like Clam Chowder, because you like Pina Colada.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你喜歡海鮮蛤蜊湯，因爲你喜歡‘椰林飄香’。

sentences.english: In the coconut groves at the edge of the field, the trees were stripped of leaves.
sentences.chinese: 草地邊上的小椰林裏，椰樹都光禿禿的沒有了葉子。

definition: Lüdao or Lutao township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
water and sky merge in one color (idiom)
sea breeze/sea wind (i.e. from the sea)
Yalong Bay in Sanya 三亞|三亚[San1 ya4], Hainan
verdant/lush green and full of life
lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
(of an area) to have trees with shade-giving foliage/(of a road) to be tree-lined
